New Records: The White Sox established a franchise record with their 107th loss, remaining on pace to supplant the 1962 Mets as the worst team in MLB history.
Francisco Lindor extended his on-base streak to 30 games, the longest active streak in the major leagues.
Key Match Events: Sean Manaea pitched seven shutout innings, allowing only two hits and walking two with five strikeouts.
Francisco Lindor hit a solo home run in the fourth inning, his 29th of the season.
Reed Garrett and Edwin Diaz combined to work the final two innings scoreless, with Diaz striking out the side in the ninth.
Garrett Crochet tied a White Sox record by striking out seven straight batters to begin his start.
Starling Marte delivered an RBI double in the ninth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Sean Manaea expressed optimism about the team's position for a playoff run.
Francisco Lindor commented on Manaea's improving performance and expressed satisfaction with the team's current standing.
Manager Carlos Mendoza praised Manaea's performance and demeanor on the mound.
